subject: Critical Thinking
title: Logic in AI: How Machines Reason
description: A quick, practical guide to Logic in AI: How Machines Reason.

hook.text: Early AI was pure logic ‚Äî feed it rules and facts, let it deduce conclusions. It worked brilliantly and terribly.

buildup.text: Expert systems of the 1980s used thousands of if-then rules to diagnose diseases and identify minerals.

discovery.text: The problem: the real world is messy. Pure logic can't handle uncertainty, ambiguity, or common sense.

twist.text: Modern AI (neural networks) abandoned formal logic for pattern recognition ‚Äî and it works far better.

climax.text: Today's frontier: combining neural networks' pattern skills with logic's reasoning power. The best of both.

punchline.text: AI started with logic, abandoned it, and now needs it back.

quiz.question: Why did early logic-based AI struggle with real-world problems?
options: The real world has too much uncertainty and ambiguity
